content.prompt:
Photo © Jorge Pérez de Lara

The basic form of the camelid sacrum in the shape of a canine from prehistoric Mexico was most likely determined by the

choices.label: natural shape of the animal bone into which it was carved
sacred status given to canine animals in ancient Mesoamerica
desired function of the object as a ceremonial headdress
influence of imagery found in other examples of ancient Mesoamerican art

topic.text: 1.2: Materials, Processes, and Techniques in Prehistoric Art

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Explain how artistic decisions about form, style, materials, technique, and/or content shape a work of art (or group of related works of art).
